meanings.definition: To bring into harmony or agreement
meanings.sent1: Listening to calming music attunes my mind to peace.
meanings.sent2: The choir attunes their voices before the performance.
meanings.sent3: His ability to attune different opinions saved the day.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter attunes the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze attunes the leaves to dance in unison.

meanings.sent1: The workshop attunes students to new ideas.
meanings.sent2: The meditation session attunes participants to their inner selves.
meanings.sent3: The sudden noise attunes everyone to the emergency.
meanings.sent4: The guide attunes the tourists to the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent5: The teacher attunes the class to the importance of kindness.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a particular situation or environment
meanings.sent1: She quickly attunes to the fast-paced work environment.
meanings.sent2: The chameleon attunes its colors to blend with its surroundings.
meanings.sent3: His taste buds attune to the spicy food after a few bites.
meanings.sent4: The team attunes their strategy to match the opponent's tactics.
meanings.sent5: The plant attunes its growth to the amount of sunlight it receives.
